texts.definition: Actions where the intent is to kill or otherwise overcome opponents.
markups: <style="Definition">Actions where the intent is to kill or otherwise overcome opponents.</style>

Symbolizing the actions between game elements in games as <style="CurrentLink">Combat</style> is one of the oldest and most common ways to give games themes. By doing so, the theme of the game contains a link with the real-world competition between players as well as alludes to the tension, uncertainty, and importance of the real-world equivalent. <style="CurrentLink">Combat</style> in games give players clear goals and opponents and gives clear indication of what players have succeeded and what players have failed.

Already many of the earliest games known to man, e.g. <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Chess">Chess</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Go">Go</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Hnefatafl">Hnefatafl</link></style> and <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Pachisi">Pachisi</link></style> have <style="CurrentLink">Combat</style> as a central part of gameplay. This has been carried on in <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Category:Miniature%20Games">Miniature Games</link></style> (e.g. <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Warhammer%2040K">Warhammer 40K</link></style>) and <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Category:Wargames">Wargames</link></style> (e.g. <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Kriegsspiel">Kriegsspiel</link></style> and <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Advanced%20Squad%20Leader">Advanced Squad Leader</link></style>). The level of granularity in which <style="CurrentLink">Combat</style> can take place can vary significantly: <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Category:Tabletop%20Roleplaying%20Games">Tabletop Roleplaying Games</link></style> such as <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Dungeons%20&%20Dragons">Dungeons & Dragons</link></style> and <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/GURPS">GURPS</link></style> pit individual combatants against each other with game rounds of 5 or 1 seconds (the <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Category:Board%20Games">Board Game</link></style> <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Car%20Wars">Car Wars</link></style> uses segments of 0.1 or 0.2 seconds depending on which edition is played) while the <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Axis%20&%20Allies">Axis & Allies</link></style> and the <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Hearts%20of%20Iron%20series">Hearts of Iron series</link></style> model the entire World War 2.

Computer-based games offer up the possibility to have computer-controlled opponents and have <style="CurrentLink">Combat</style> take place in real-time. <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Category:Fighting%20Games">Fighting Games</link></style> such as the <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Dead%20or%20Alive%20series">Dead or Alive</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Mortal%20Kombat%20series">Mortal Kombat</link></style> and <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Tekken%20series">Tekken series</link></style> make use of both these features to provide gameplay focus purely on <style="CurrentLink">Combat</style>, having tournaments and unlocking new characters or new costumes as goals besides winning the current fight. <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Category:FPS%20Games">First-Person Shooters</link></style> such as the <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Doom%20series">Doom</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Quake%20series">Quake</link></style>, and <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Unreal%20Tournament%20series">Unreal Tournament series</link></style> do the same and the <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Battlefield%20series">Battlefield</link></style> and <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Team%20Fortress%20series">Team Fortress series</link></style> show how these can be designed as team-based games where players take on specific classes. <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Gauntlet">Gauntlet</link></style> and <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Torchlight">Torchlight</link></style> show how the idea of <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Category:Roleplaying%20Games">Roleplaying Games</link></style> can be given a much more <style="CurrentLink">Combat</style> and exploration-oriented structure in computer-based games, while <style="Link"><link="massively-multiplayer-online-games">Massively Multiplayer Online Games</link></style> such as <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Ultima%20Online">Ultima Online</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/World%20of%20Warcraft">World of Warcraft</link></style>, and <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Eve%20Online">Eve Online</link></style> make it a common but elective activity. Other games also have <style="CurrentLink">Combat</style> as optional components. Players of <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Empires%20&%20Allies">Empires & Allies</link></style> can be safe from other players' attacks by declaring neutrality and those playing <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Race%20for%20the%20Galaxy">Race for the Galaxy</link></style> can avoid <style="CurrentLink">Combat</style> by not playing some types of cards. Although <style="CurrentLink">Combat</style> is most often a big part of the gameplay in the <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Fallout%20series">Fallout series</link></style> there is often peaceful ways of resolving quests.

<style="CurrentLink">Combat</style> is the means to achieving <style="Link"><link="capture">Capture</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="overcome">Overcome</link></style>, or <style="Link"><link="eliminate">Eliminate</link></style> goals against <style="Link"><link="enemies">Enemies</link></style> so these need to be present in order for <style="CurrentLink">Combat</style> to occur in games. While these goals may be reason enough for <style="CurrentLink">Combat</style>, wanting <style="Link"><link="area-control">Area Control</link></style> or <style="Link"><link="loot">Loot</link></style> is often an underlying cause. Given as a means to ruin others <style="Link"><link="guard">Guard</link></style> goals, <style="CurrentLink">Combat</style> and together with <style="Link"><link="guard">Guard</link></style> make <style="Link"><link="rescue">Rescue</link></style> goals possible. A number of patterns can then be applied to the <style="CurrentLink">Combat</style> to modify this, including <style="Link"><link="achilles-heels">Achilles' Heels</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="always-vulnerable">Always Vulnerable</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="armor">Armor</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Attributes">Attributes</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="combos">Combos</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="damage">Damage</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="friendly-fire">Friendly Fire</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="health">Health</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="invulnerabilities">Invulnerabilities</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="privileged-abilities">Privileged Abilities</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="safe-havens">Safe Havens</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="skills">Skills</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="tools">Tools</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="vulnerabilities">Vulnerabilities</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="weapons">Weapons</link></style>, and <style="Link"><link="zone-control">Zone of Control</link></style>. <style="Link"><link="randomness">Randomness</link></style> is ''very'' common and often used to allow <style="Link"><link="critical-hits">Critical Hits</link></style> to cause more or special types of <style="Link"><link="damage">Damage</link></style> or <style="Link"><link="critical-misses">Critical Misses</link></style> than may cause various <style="Link"><link="penalties">Penalties</link></style>. The design of <style="Link"><link="game-worlds">Game Worlds</link></style> or <style="Link"><link="levels">Levels</link></style> can heavily influence how <style="CurrentLink">Combat</style> unfolds or where players seek to have <style="CurrentLink">Combat</style>: <style="Link"><link="arenas">Arenas</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="choke-points">Choke Points</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="environmental-effects">Environmental Effects</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="flanking-routes">Flanking Routes</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="galleries">Galleries</link></style>, and <style="Link"><link="sniper-locations">Sniper Locations</link></style> are all examples of possibilities here, and these can lead to activities such as sniping or <style="Link"><link="camping">Camping</link></style>. <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Imperfect%20Information">Imperfect Information</link></style> may relate to the various patterns mentioned here through using <style="Link"><link="fog-war">Fog of War</link></style> to limit knowledge about combat environments.

One thing <style="CurrentLink">Combat</style> requires is at least two different sides fighting each other. This can be entirely <style="Link"><link="avatars">Avatars</link></style> or <style="Link"><link="units">Units</link></style> controlled by players, <style="Link"><link="non-player-characters">Non-Player Characters</link></style> with <style="Link"><link="preventing-goals">Preventing Goals</link></style>, or <style="Link"><link="enemies">Enemies</link></style> controlled by <style="Link"><link="dedicated-game-facilitators">Dedicated Game Facilitators</link></style>; the use of <style="Link"><link="algorithmic-agents">Algorithmic Agents</link></style> can allow <style="Link"><link="single-player-games">Single-Player Games</link></style> to have <style="CurrentLink">Combat</style>. <style="Link"><link="bases">Bases</link></style> are not necessarily able to engage others in <style="CurrentLink">Combat</style> but may be on the target of aggression. Players' fortunes in <style="CurrentLink">Combat</style> can change from being only depending on their gameplay skills to being the result of <style="Link"><link="player-character-skill-composites">Player/Character Skill Composites</link></style> and <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Player/System%20Action%20Composites">Player/System Action Composites</link></style> if <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Attributes">Attributes</link></style> or <style="Link"><link="skills">Skills</link></style> are used to affect evaluation functions related to <style="CurrentLink">Combat</style>. <style="CurrentLink">Combat</style> is common in <style="Link"><link="massively-multiplayer-online-games">Massively Multiplayer Online Games</link></style>, either as <style="Link"><link="pvp">PvP</link></style> or <style="Link"><link="pve">PvE</link></style>, while in games on social media platforms, e.g. <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Empires%20&%20Allies">Empires & Allies</link></style>, let players have <style="Link"><link="safe-havens">Safe Havens</link></style> through providing them with <style="Link"><link="private-game-spaces">Private Game Spaces</link></style> unless they let their <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Neighbors">Neighbors</link></style> attack them.

Having as much information as possible if often advantageous in games with <style="CurrentLink">Combat</style>. This since any <style="CurrentLink">Combat</style> where <style="Link"><link="surprise-attacks">Surprise Attacks</link></style> can occur require skill sets regarding perception and misdirection besides those directly related to fighting. Games that wish to have <style="Link"><link="surprise-attacks">Surprise Attacks</link></style> can most easily do so by providing <style="Link"><link="fog-war">Fog of War</link></style> to the combatants.

Beyond these specifics of all these design options, a highly influencing factor on how <style="CurrentLink">Combat</style> can be designed in games is whether they are <style="Link"><link="real-time-games">Real-Time Games</link></style> or <style="Link"><link="turn-based-games">Turn-Based Games</link></style>. <style="Link"><link="line-sight">Line of Sight</link></style> is quite frequently used both but for different reasons: in <style="Link"><link="turn-based-games">Turn-Based Games</link></style> they are used to simulate the paths of projectiles while they are often present "for free" in <style="Link"><link="real-time-games">Real-Time Games</link></style> due to the use of <style="Link"><link="aim-shoot">Aim & Shoot</link></style> actions to perform <style="CurrentLink">Combat</style>.

In <style="Link"><link="turn-based-games">Turn-Based Games</link></style>, <style="CurrentLink">Combat</style> are usually based on complex evaluation functions or a large number of simpler evaluation functions, and gameplay concerns trying to make game states have as many favorable modifiers as possible. In these types of games, <style="Link"><link="budgeted-action-points">Budgeted Action Points</link></style> can allow several actions in individual <style="CurrentLink">Combat</style> turns and thereby create <style="Link"><link="trade-offs">Trade-Offs</link></style> between different possible actions (see <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Space%20Hulk">Space Hulk</link></style> and the <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Fallout%20series">Fallout series</link></style> for examples of this). <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Imperfect%20Information">Imperfect Information</link></style> exists mainly due to not knowing the opponents strengths, weaknesses, and configurations, while <style="Link"><link="randomness">Randomness</link></style> is usually instantiated through <style="Link"><link="dice">Dice</link></style> or the equivalent.

<style="Link"><link="real-time-games">Real-Time Games</link></style> may have as advanced evaluation functions as <style="Link"><link="turn-based-games">Turn-Based Games</link></style>, but players usually do not have the possibilities of considering all of these. Here, a main difference may be if players control <style="Link"><link="avatars">Avatars</link></style> or <style="Link"><link="units">Units</link></style> since the latter requires <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Attention%20Swapping">Attention Swapping</link></style>. <style="Link"><link="aim-shoot">Aim & Shoot</link></style> is common in <style="Link"><link="real-time-games">Real-Time Games</link></style> - nearly always together with <style="Link"><link="crosshairs">Crosshairs</link></style> - and may be modulated by <style="Link"><link="variable-accuracy">Variable Accuracy</link></style> and <style="Link"><link="auto-aim">Auto-Aim</link></style> support (both which can make <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Player/System%20Action%20Composites">Player/System Action Composites</link></style> - or <style="Link"><link="player-character-skill-composites">Player/Character Skill Composites</link></style> if <style="Link"><link="skills">Skills</link></style> affect them - present in the game). For these types of <style="CurrentLink">Combat</style>, <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Imperfect%20Information">Imperfect Information</link></style> is often due to bad players having <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Game%20State%20Overview">Game State Overview</link></style>. To avoid <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Repeated%20Domination">Repeated Domination</link></style> due to this, <style="Link"><link="killcams">Killcams</link></style> can be used to reveal the location of killers.

If <style="CurrentLink">Combat</style> is the only activity in the game, as is the case in fighting games, it is often structured in <style="Link"><link="tournaments">Tournaments</link></style> to allow <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Perceivable%20Margins">Perceivable Margins</link></style> and <style="Link"><link="higher-level-closures-gameplay-progresses">Higher-Level Closures as Gameplay Progresses</link></style> by having more difficult opponents appear later in the <style="Link"><link="tournaments">Tournament</link></style>. <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Category:Fighting%20Games">Fighting Games</link></style> also often combine <style="CurrentLink">Combat</style> losses with <style="Link"><link="player-elimination">Player Elimination</link></style>. Games where players engage in activities other than <style="CurrentLink">Combat</style> usually make use of <style="Link"><link="lives">Lives</link></style> and penalize loss of <style="Link"><link="lives">Lives</link></style> by <style="Link"><link="ability-losses">Ability Losses</link></style> and <style="Link"><link="spawning">Spawning</link></style> at earlier locations. <style="Link"><link="real-time-games">Real-Time Games</link></style> with <style="Link"><link="teams">Teams</link></style> and <style="Link"><link="friendly-fire">Friendly Fire</link></style> often have special <style="Link"><link="penalties">Penalties</link></style> for team killing. Some games allow <style="CurrentLink">Combat</style> early on but are structured so it comes into focus heavily in the <style="Link"><link="endgame">Endgame</link></style> through the presence of an <style="Link"><link="extermination">Extermination</link></style> phase. Regardless, games in which <style="CurrentLink">Combat</style> is possible tend to have it as a central part of gameplay and have interconnected it with aspects such as <style="Link"><link="improved-abilities">Improved Abilities</link></style> and <style="Link"><link="strategic-knowledge">Strategic Knowledge</link></style>.

While <style="Link"><link="boss-monsters">Boss Monsters</link></style> may in some games be defeated by the same type of <style="CurrentLink">Combat</style> that can defeat other <style="Link"><link="enemies">Enemies</link></style>, some games make regular <style="CurrentLink">Combat</style> impossible against them to either require other types of solutions or to keep the <style="Link"><link="boss-monsters">Boss Monsters</link></style> alive to a later stage in the gameplay.

<style="CurrentLink">Combat</style> provides <style="Link"><link="abilities">Abilities</link></style> for players to deal with <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Conflicts">Conflicts</link></style> in games, but since the players' <style="Link"><link="enemies">Enemies</link></style> may cause problems through the <style="CurrentLink">Combat</style> it may also require <style="Link"><link="attention-demanding-gameplay">Attention Demanding Gameplay</link></style> and cause <style="Link"><link="tension">Tension</link></style>. Since <style="CurrentLink">Combat</style> postulates a presence of an opposing force, games with <style="CurrentLink">Combat</style> are more likely to have <style="Link"><link="challenging-gameplay">Challenging Gameplay</link></style> than those without it. <style="CurrentLink">Combat</style> typically can lead to the loss of <style="Link"><link="units">Units</link></style> or removal of <style="Link"><link="destructible-objects">Destructible Objects</link></style>, and in the case of games with <style="Link"><link="avatars">Avatars</link></style> to <style="Link"><link="player-killing">Player Killing</link></style>. <style="Link"><link="player-elimination">Player Elimination</link></style> can in turn be a consequence of any of these.

When the participating in <style="CurrentLink">Combat</style> is optional, or when who to attack is optional, players have a <style="Link"><link="freedom-choice">Freedom of Choice</link></style> and need to consider the <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Risk/Reward">Risk/Reward</link></style> and <style="Link"><link="trade-offs">Trade-Offs</link></style> that exist between participating in the <style="CurrentLink">Combat</style> and performing other activities. Choosing to attack other players will most likely reveal that these <style="Link"><link="actions-have-diegetically-social-consequences">Actions Have Diegetically Social Consequences</link></style>, especially in games that have <style="Link"><link="player-killing">Player Killing</link></style> or <style="Link"><link="player-elimination">Player Elimination</link></style>. Players can also have <style="Link"><link="freedom-choice">Freedom of Choice</link></style> in <style="CurrentLink">Combat</style> when they can attack in several different ways, and this is also typically offers <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Risk/Reward">Risk/Reward</link></style> choices and <style="Link"><link="trade-offs">Trade-Offs</link></style>.

<style="CurrentLink">Combat</style> that is combined with <style="Link"><link="real-time-games">Real-Time Games</link></style> can make <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Timing">Timing</link></style> or the execution of <style="Link"><link="dexterity-based-actions">Dexterity-Based Actions</link></style> important in games. How well this or other types of <style="CurrentLink">Combat</style> is performed can be the basis for <style="Link"><link="character-development">Character Development</link></style>, e.g. by giving <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Experience%20Points">Experience Points</link></style> (as for example <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Dungeons%20&%20Dragons">Dungeons & Dragons</link></style> or <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Return%20to%20Castle%20Wolfenstein:%20Enemy%20Territory">Return to Castle Wolfenstein: Enemy Territory</link></style> does). When the success or failure of an attack depends on player skill but the <style="Link"><link="damage">Damage</link></style> depends on game statistics of <style="Link"><link="weapons">Weapons</link></style> or <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Powers">Powers</link></style>, this is an example of <style="Link"><link="player-character-skill-composites">Player/Character Skill Composites</link></style>.

<style="Link"><link="abilities">Abilities</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="actions-have-diegetically-social-consequences">Actions Have Diegetically Social Consequences</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="attention-demanding-gameplay">Attention Demanding Gameplay</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="challenging-gameplay">Challenging Gameplay</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="destructible-objects">Destructible Objects</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="extermination">Extermination</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="freedom-choice">Freedom of Choice</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="player-elimination">Player Elimination</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="player-killing">Player Killing</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="pve">PvE</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="pvp">PvP</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Risk/Reward">Risk/Reward</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="tension">Tension</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="trade-offs">Trade-Offs</link></style>

<style="Link"><link="area-control">Area Control</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="bases">Bases</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="character-development">Character Development</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Conflicts">Conflicts</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Experience%20Points">Experience Points</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="massively-multiplayer-online-games">Massively Multiplayer Online Games</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="units">Units</link></style>

<style="Link"><link="achilles-heels">Achilles' Heels</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="aim-shoot">Aim & Shoot</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="always-vulnerable">Always Vulnerable</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="arenas">Arenas</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="armor">Armor</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Attributes">Attributes</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="budgeted-action-points">Budgeted Action Points</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="camping">Camping</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="choke-points">Choke Points</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="combos">Combos</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="critical-hits">Critical Hits</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="critical-misses">Critical Misses</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="crosshairs">Crosshairs</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="damage">Damage</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="dedicated-game-facilitators">Dedicated Game Facilitators</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="environmental-effects">Environmental Effects</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="flanking-routes">Flanking Routes</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="fog-war">Fog of War</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="friendly-fire">Friendly Fire</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="galleries">Galleries</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="health">Health</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Imperfect%20Information">Imperfect Information</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="improved-abilities">Improved Abilities</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="invulnerabilities">Invulnerabilities</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="killcams">Killcams</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="line-sight">Line of Sight</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="lives">Lives</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="loot">Loot</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Neighbors">Neighbors</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="player-character-skill-composites">Player/Character Skill Composites</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Player/System%20Action%20Composites">Player/System Action Composites</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="privileged-abilities">Privileged
